intro: Zschokkea standleyi, commonly known as the Yucatan orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Mexico and Central America. It typically grows on trees and rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a short, fleshy stem and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Zschokkea standleyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
